alert.note: Alert for Palo Verde Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 21 at 10:54PM PST until December 22 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM MST /5 AM PST/ FRIDAY THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall will be possible. * WHERE...Portions of Arizona, including the following areas, Aguila Valley, Apache Junction/Gold Canyon, Buckeye/Avondale, Cave Creek/New River, Central La Paz, Central Phoenix, Deer Valley, Dripping Springs, East Valley, Fountain Hills/East Mesa, Gila Bend, Gila River Valley, Globe/Miami, Kofa, Mazatzal Mountains, New River Mesa, North Phoenix/Glendale, Northwest Pinal County, Northwest Valley, Parker Valley, Pinal/Superstition Mountains, Rio Verde/Salt River, San Carlos, Scottsdale/Paradise Valley, Sonoran Desert Natl Monument, South Mountain/Ahwatukee, Southeast Gila County, Southeast Valley/Queen Creek, Southeast Yuma County, Superior, Tonopah Desert, Tonto Basin and West Pinal County and southeast California, including the following area, Palo Verde Valley. * WHEN...From 6 AM MST /5 AM PST/ Friday through late Friday night. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Widespread rainfall with a couple isolated thunderstorms will occur Friday. Moderate rainfall can be expected at times with total rainfall amounts averaging between 0.75" to 1.50" across the Watch area. Locally higher amounts of 1.50-2.00" are possible across higher terrain of Maricopa and Gila Counties. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
